meanings.definition: To incorporate (attitudes or ideas) into one's personality unconsciously.
meanings.sent1: She introjected the positive feedback from her teacher, feeling more confident.
meanings.sent2: He introjected the advice from his friend and decided to take a different approach.
meanings.sent3: The cat introjected the playful behavior of the dog, trying to chase its own tail.
meanings.sent4: The introjected memories of her childhood played like a movie in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The introjected emotions swirled inside her, influencing her decisions without her realizing.

meanings.definition: An unconscious internalization of aspects of the external world.
meanings.sent1: His introjected beliefs about success came from his family's values.
meanings.sent2: The introjected cultural norms shaped her perception of beauty.
meanings.sent3: The introjected idea of the talking tree in the story made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her introjected fears loomed large in her dreams, manifesting as monsters.
meanings.sent5: The introjected memories of her hometown brought a sense of nostalgia whenever she thought of them.
